contentrichtext.text: In [[neuroscience]], '''quantum brain dynamics''' (QBD) is a hypothesis to explain the function of the [[brain]] within the framework of [[quantum field theory]]. Large systems, such as those studied biologically, have less symmetry than the idealized systems or single crystals often studied in physics. [[Jeffrey Goldstone]] proved that where symmetry is broken, additional [[boson]]s, the [[Nambu-Goldstone boson]]s, will then be observed in the spectrum of possible states; one canonical example being the [[phonon]] in a [[crystal]]. Ricciardi and Umezawa proposed in 1967 a general theory of quanta of long-range [[Coherence (physics)|coherent]] waves within and between brain cells, and showed a possible mechanism of memory storage and retrieval in terms of Nambu-Goldstone bosons.<ref name="Umezawa1967">{{cite journal |author = Ricciardi LM, Umezawa H |title = Brain and physics of many-body problems |journal = Kybernetik |volume = 4 |year = 1967 |pages = 44–48 }}</ref> This was later fleshed out into a theory encompassing all biological cells and systems in the quantum biodynamics of Del Giudice and co-authors.<ref name="DelGiudice1986">{{cite journal |author = Del Giudice E, Doglia S, Milani M, Vitiello G |title = Electromagnetic field and spontaneous symmetry breaking in biological matter |journal = Nucl. Phys. B |volume = 275 |year = 1986 |pages = 185–199 }}</ref><ref name="DelGiudice1988">{{cite journal |author = Del Giudice E, [[Giuliano Preparata|Preparata G]], Vitiello G |title = Water as a free electric dipole laser |journal = Physical Review Letters |volume = 61 |year = 1988 |pages = 1085–1088 }}</ref> Mari Jibu and Kunio Yasue later popularized these results and discussed the implications towards consciousness.<ref name="Jibu1995">{{cite book | author = Jibu M, Yasue K | title = Quantum Brain Dynamics: An Introduction | publisher = John Benjamins | series = | location = Amsterdam | year = 1995 | doi = | isbn = }}</ref><ref name="Jibu1997">{{cite journal |author = Jibu M, Yasue K |title = What is mind?
